comment: Whitehead doesn't care about students' learning. This is evident in the obfuscatory ways in which he responds to questions. What he cares about is showing off and making sure his ego remains well-protected. His lectures are arrogant in overall tone and punctuated with remarks about things meant to boost his ego (e.g., who his PhD supervisor was).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Not bad for online course
rating_tags: Respected--Online Savvy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very easy for a Philosophy class. Quizzes have unlimited attempts so you have to actively try to fail them. The discussion assignments are a participation grade you have to write no more than a paragraph for. The tests are the only part of this class you can fail so be prepared for them. Otherwise a really interesting and thought-provoking class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is a very knowledgeable man but a poor professor. His lectures are hour long sessions of him showing off his "exquisite" vocabulary more than helping his students grasp the concepts. Nearly impossible to reach by email, has a poor class layout plan. I am in my 4th year, have a 3.4 GPA and his class was the first I ever withdrew from.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: This is the hardest class I have ever taken in my life. If you dont pay attention to any of his lectures you will fail. His quizzes are 3 to 4 question so if you miss one you fail. Tests are 10 to 11 questions. Please dont take his class if you slack off. His class is extremely hard. I recommend you take another professor to avoid the stress.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Literally the hardest teacher ever. Im a A/B student and Ive never failed a class before. Hes very passionate about philosophy but you will not be able to comprehend what comes out his mouth in lectures . Quizzes are 4 questions max and tests are less than 10 questions. This class is extremely hard. Please take another teacher
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Prof Whitehead is obviously very passionate about philosophy, but not good at teaching it or grading it. Took this class online and we had 2 weekly quizzes with 3 questions each (miss one question you fail). You pretty much have to teach yourself the content through reading, and finding the assignments was like playing hide and seek. Would not take
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Whitehead was my overall favorite professor at KSU. He has a real love for the subjects he teaches and imparts that passion onto you, if you care to learn it. If you don't care for the subject matter, you probably won't have fun. But if you find it interesting, he should be on your short list of must-take professors.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: on one of the 12 question tests on a short answer question I answered with a word for word textbook description and got 1/3 points when told to define. When asking for help to do better on the next he gave no constructive feedback and basically told me to study more when I spent 12 hours in 2 days memorizing the text word for word post normal study
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Whitehead makes sure you know that the class is a difficult class, so be aware. Overall the class is not overloaded with unnecessary assignments. Instead he relies on class discussions that are essential for your learning. Do your readings and participate in class as much as possible, trying goes a long way.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Whitehead is nearly inaccessible as he takes 2-3 BUSINESS DAYS to answer an email. Most professors reply in less than 24 business hours. When he does respond it's never with an answer or anything helpful. The material is dense and very hard to understand, don't expect him to help you. Look for help from classmates, and extra research.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Whitehead seemed to be more interested in his ego than in the learning of his students. Each lecture ensured an hour of pretentious droning with little payoff. His 'tests' were papers with no instructions, then a failing grade when his 'instructions' weren't met. I could not be paid enough money to retake him. Thanks for ruining my GPA.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Whitehead truly knows his stuff; however, he does not know how to be a good professor. I took him for an online class where we had weekly papers due, and he would give me poor grades without explanation. Upon contacting him, he did not seem to know why my grade was so low, but refused to do anything. As a result I was forced to withdraw.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Tests are tough

comment: It IS possible to do well if you keep up the work. This is not the kind of course where As and Bs are given just because you enrolled in the course.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Clear grading criteria--Tests are tough

comment: Dont take this class whatever you do! He is by far the toughest grader. His test are around 12 questions and half of them are open ended, his quizzes are around 3 questions so if you miss one you fail. Im an A and B student and I failed his course, I put the work in but still failed because of his tough grading style. Very opinionated class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Tests are tough

comment: THIS PROFESSOR IS TERRIBLE. PHILOSOPHY IS ALREADY COMPLICATED. HE FURTHER COMPLICATES THE CLASS WITH TOUGH GRADING AND HARD TESTING. IF YOU CARE ABOUT YOUR GRADE AND HEALTH SAVE YOURSELF THE STRESS.
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: TERRIBLE. He clearly does not want his students to succeed. His assignments are completely unclear. He will not elaborate on what he expects. His midterm was basically a guessing game. He did not give a study guide or even mention what topics would be on the test. He's arrogant and likes to hear himself talk. If you care about your GPA, don't take.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very difficult material. Very tough grader. Challenging course - proud of the C.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback

comment: Online Class is Hard. DISCUSSION BOARD ASSIGNMENT IS VERY GENERIC, HARD TO COMPLETE ASSIGNMENT.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: He's a god awful grader that clearly does not believe you should be able to get an A in his class. He's clearly in love with himself, and not with students' success.  He essentially just confuses you until you are able to regurgitate what he wants to hear. Don't try to figure anything out or come to any conclusions, you will get points taken off.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Although difficult to remember all content, he is very clear in class and will spell out the answers he wants on the test. Pay close attention to his lectures and you will do fine. He takes attendance, but it doesn't count towards your grade because he knows it is impossible to pass without attending. He gives a study guide.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He's not a great communicator. Even when using the KSU email, it still took him 3 days to reply. The content and access to modules are very controlled. I felt horrible as I've never done this horribly in a class. After contacting random students int he class, it became clear that he's not a great educator.
Took the class. Found it easy, but was graded very hard. I suggest to prepare mentally to take the class, do not let this review steer you away.

Not only was the test average a 16.9% but he posted the rubric for the essay two weeks after he posted the grade. He is clearly intelligent but also unaware of the world around him. He posted a response after the test with specifics to how he expected the test to be answered. Here's. Thought, post it before so people can pass.

If you are interested in philosophy, you will learn a lot in Prof. Whitehead's class. Here's the thing though, do not take it online. With the level of deep processing required to do well in his class, it is important to be able to discuss it in person with him and with classmates. I had to work extremely hard to do well and protect my GPA.
His teaching style of using analogies always made learning material easier for me.

Unlike what the other reviews say, this class is actually quite easy. He practically gives you the test questions on a study guide a week or two before test for you to complete, then goes over it the day before the test to answer questions you may have. The lectures are quite interesting on certain concepts and gives new perspective on how we think

He's strange at first, but by the end of the semester, he was my favorite. Super smart. Class is mostly discussion. Tests are straight memorization of what he says in reviewclasses. Readings every week, but they aren't longboring. There is one paper and three tests.

If you want to succeed in anything worth succeeding in, you have to put in the effort. You cannot expect everything to be spoon fed to you. He is one of the best there is. You just have to do the work. Took him for both PHIL 3030 and PHIL 4210.

This was an awkward class because I'm not used to professors intentionally overcomplicating already complicated material.  Syllabus not arranged to benefit students' progress since he's a tough grader. He doesn't think having "too many" A's is a good thing.  He could improve on becoming a better educator rather than dispersing HIS philosophy.

Professor Whitehead is my favorite professor I have had at KSU. He is very understanding and will work with you on anything you have trouble with. With that said, he is a very hard grader and you need to make sure to completely do the reviews before the test. Have to go to class but classes are very interesting.

Without a doubt this was the hardest class I have ever had in college but this professor really made something out of nothing. I would still come to this class if I didn't have to because the actual lectures are so interesting! He is just a very hard professor to read. Intelligent, humorous, and straight up interesting to watch him teach a class.

don't let him get to you the first class; he makes it seem hard, but it isn't that serious. also, stick around even if your first few grades are trash because HE WILL WORK WITH STUDENTS AND GIVE EXTRA CREDIT IF YOU ASK AND IT'S REASONABLE. also, DISSECT EVERY QUESTION OF HIS TESTS AND PUT EXACTLY WHAT HE WANTS (damn what you think the answer is).

On the first day he tried to intimidate us, saying that we would be lucky to get a B. In reality, he is not harsh at all. We had 2 tests and 2 short essays plus a final. The tests are short answer, but he gives study guides and reviews all the answers specifically. Philosophy is difficult, but he does a good job of explaining and giving examples.

Professor Whitehead is great, I genuinely enjoyed his class. He cares about what he teaches and is very encouraging. Grades are based on short papers (500 words) and a midterm and final. You definitely need to show up to class though. If you need to take philosophy, take his class.

The class is demanding, but it is possible to do well. 4 papers, a mid-term, and a final. Attendance is mandatory and also necessary for success... this is not a class you can skip... ever. Professor is helpful and encourages students to meet with him during office hours if they're in need of extra help. I received an A but I had to work to get it.
